value: chapter 19 to save Ali our first few
days living with the pastor past
uneventful as we adjusted to our new
surroundings he and his 14 year old boy
lived in a rented farmhouse on a
beautiful piece of Missouri wilderness
my wife and I would sleep upstairs in
the loft allow for children would share
two rooms downstairs but on one of the
first nights annika suddenly awoke me
from my sleep honey she breathed with
the darkness had a terrible dream what
she saw was the pastor's wife who was no
longer living with him turn into a
vampire bite deeply into hanukkah's neck
I knew my wife received dreams when yah
was trying to relay something very
important so I was determined to find
out what it actually happened between
the pastor and his missing wife early in
the morning the pastor and I would head
out in a small car packed to the gills
with boxes of nutrients supplements and
all natural health solutions we'd spend
the rest of the day driving to different
health food stores throughout Southeast
Missouri in northern Arkansas delivering
various quarters to his customers on one
of these bright are the mornings as we
drove on a winding road to the thick
green of southern Missouri I ventured to
ask the pastor what had happened you
guys seemed so in love when we visited
you three years ago I said shaking my
head
what happened he explained how his wife
had left him many times throughout the
marriage complaining about the hardships
than history this last time she had left
the three months and then finally
returning tears begging forgiveness the
yah told me not to forgive her the
pastor said so I told her she was not
welcome back home recalling hanukkah's
dream and now during this pastor story
something did not sound right yet try as
I might could not put my finger on it
what I did notice right off is that from
the jovial is that far from the jovial
person I had remembered from three years
ago he now seemed very moody distance
and withdrawn I wasn't about the
challenge of pastor who've been walking
in the Torah and the spirit years longer
than I had about a word he had received
from Yahweh himself but even so
something deep down inside unsettled
that first Shabbat was an overwhelmingly
joyous one for annika myself and our
children about a dozen people filled the
pastor's living room and there were even
a few families with little ones for
three years in California we had
virtually gone without any sort of
fellowship so this was like crystal cool
spring water splashed into our faces
refreshing to the court the house of
Israel
the house of Israel fellowship as the
pastor had dubbed it with a sign hanging
on the living room window with those
very words etched into white cardboard
have the custom referring to each other
as brother and sister something onic and
I were unfamiliar with from the west
coast there was brother Gene bushy white
beard eyes twinkled with joy lean but
tough telling me stories from his
adventure filled past there was sister
Joan kind woman who had often had new
books about the Hebrew roots the faith
and of course never forgot to bring her
fresh goat milk for our little man and
there was brotherly in his late 40s dark
hair started to gray the thin dark beer
and clear blue eyes over the next
several weeks I would grow up closest to
him assumed share with me how the spirit
was working in his life his humble warm
attitude was in stark contrast to
withdraw and moodiness of the pastor on
that first Shabbat the pastor announced
I want everyone to remember that this
place is not mine this is yawns which is
why I called this fellowship the house
of Israel the words were comforting and
over the next month and a half as I
would continue to work for the pastor
and annika would settle into a routine
of homeschooling the children my
unsettled feeling drifted into the
background almost completely forgotten
then the Feast of Tabernacles arrived in
mid-october of 2006 excitement buzz
throughout the farm as about 15 of us
pitched our tents and campers across the
pastor's farm we would have joy
celebration singing and most importantly
fellowship that first night of
Tabernacles well while I was playing
with my children in the living room a
very strange incident occurred in the
kitchen annika had been busily preparing
a meal for everyone but the pastor
objected annika I thought I'd asked you
to make spaghetti for tonight my wife
shook her head no no I'm cooking up
something else well I'd prefer spaghetti
he said sorry already got this cooking
she smiled and continued with her tasks
I had vaguely overheard the exchange but
in all the excitement of the celebration
had not thought anything of it a couple
hours later I was seated around the
campfire with annika broly and a few
others Monica had brought out her guitar
we started singing some worship songs
she's not the same as it was last year
Rolly sighed and shook his head should
be more people to join us in singing
around the campfire about an hour layer
later as I was heading back to my tent
the pastor called to me Daniel I need to
speak with you and your wife I quickly
found Annika we met the pastor in the
pool darkness under a large oak tree in
the bright full moon I could see the
grim expression on his face we've got a
problem here I'm seeing the tape same
type of rebellion that was in my wine
right and Annika and this needs to be
dulling my thoughts real backwards over
each other my heart raced and confusion
balloon through my mind what are you
talking about I had asked your wife to
make a certain meal for this evening she
copped an attitude and refused I've seen
this before and I won't tolerate it I've
worked hard to make sure the people this
congregation enjoy sweet fellowship and
I won't have it ruined by her wife I had
no idea what to say I was both
dumbfounded and shocked I'm very sorry
Annika said I did not mean to offend you
in any way I was just already in the
middle of preparing a meal and didn't
want it to go to waste let's just make
sure we're keeping our hearts pure he
said before stocking away Monica smiled
at me as we headed back to our tent that
night and I thought maybe this little
misunderstanding I misunderstanding
which seemed downright silly to me had
blown over but has me lay in our
sleeping bags I felt my wife began to
sob held her close in the unspoken
darkness she continued
something was very very wrong after
Tabernacles the rainy season began in
earnest southern Missouri turned into a
soggy dripping landscape though there
continued to be tension between the
pastor my wife it seemed a lesson at my
own confused state of mind increased I
knew for a fact yah had called us out
her to Missouri but for some reason
rather than experiencing join one who
was as if we'd entered a cold tomb had I
misheard yah was I not supposed to be
here what was going on one Sabbath
morning sister Renee happily exclaimed
to everyone about a spiritual
breakthrough occurred she was in her 30s
married to a quiet a kind husband with a
few children of their own I've gotten
rid of all of our plates and dishes that
have images on them she said just like
the pastor teaches about the second
commander not having any great
individuals I known for many years that
this pastor interpreted the second
commandment to me you should not watch
our home anything image
I lon disagree with him on I issue would
have never become much of a conversation
piece in fact as I began to live with
the pastor I began to wonder if maybe
I've been wrong his strict
interpretation of this commandment was
in fact correct however as the rainy
season continued
and I continue to help the pastor with
the self business he would stop at
various video stores and purchase movies
often after a hard day's work the pastor
annika myself and his boy would settled
with the couch to watch an entertaining
flick I thought nothing of this until
that Sabbath morning when sister Renee
happily announced her spiritual
breakthrough it was then my band began
to perceived a very concrete sin in this
pastor he was teaching one thing while
living another in fact as I having add
upon dearne what had transpired over the
past several weeks I realized the pastor
was always careful about never
mentioning his movie watching to anyone
in the congregation
